channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Sparks of Artificial General Intelligence: Early experiments with GPT-4
item.description: We contend that (this early version of) GPT-4 is part of a new cohort of LLMs (along with ChatGPT and Google's PaLM for example) that exhibit more general intelligence than previous AI models.

item.title: VisionLLM: Large Language Model is also an Open-Ended Decoder for Vision-Centric Tasks
item.description: We hope this model can set a new baseline for generalist vision and language models.

item.title: FastComposer: Tuning-Free Multi-Subject Image Generation with Localized Attention
item.description: FastComposer proposes delayed subject conditioning in the denoising step to maintain both identity and editability in subject-driven image generation.

item.title: Tree of Thoughts: Deliberate Problem Solving with Large Language Models
item.description: Language models are increasingly being deployed for general problem solving across a wide range of tasks, but are still confined to token-level, left-to-right decision-making processes during inference.

item.title: SpeechGPT: Empowering Large Language Models with Intrinsic Cross-Modal Conversational Abilities
item.description: Multi-modal large language models are regarded as a crucial step towards Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) and have garnered significant interest with the emergence of ChatGPT.

item.title: CodeT5+: Open Code Large Language Models for Code Understanding and Generation
item.description: To address these limitations, we propose ``CodeT5+'', a family of encoder-decoder LLMs for code in which component modules can be flexibly combined to suit a wide range of downstream code tasks.

item.title: Reflexion: an autonomous agent with dynamic memory and self-reflection
item.description: To achieve full automation, we introduce a straightforward yet effective heuristic that enables the agent to pinpoint hallucination instances, avoid repetition in action sequences, and, in some environments, construct an internal memory map of the given environment.

item.title: ONE-PEACE: Exploring One General Representation Model Toward Unlimited Modalities
item.description: In this work, we explore a scalable way for building a general representation model toward unlimited modalities.

item.title: EasySpider: A No-Code Visual System for Crawling the Web
item.description: As such, web-crawling is an essential tool for both computational and non-computational scientists to conduct research.

item.title: Going Denser with Open-Vocabulary Part Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a detector with the ability to predict both open-vocabulary objects and their part segmentation.

item.title: StructGPT: A General Framework for Large Language Model to Reason over Structured Data
item.description: Specially, we propose an \emph{invoking-linearization-generation} procedure to support LLMs in reasoning on the structured data with the help of the external interfaces.

item.title: Listen, Think, and Understand
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel audio foundation model, called LTU (Listen, Think, and Understand).

item.title: Min-Max Similarity: A Contrastive Semi-Supervised Deep Learning Network for Surgical Tools Segmentation
item.description: In contrast to the previous state-of-the-art, we introduce Min-Max Similarity (MMS), a contrastive learning form of dual-view training by employing classifiers and projectors to build all-negative, and positive and negative feature pairs, respectively, to formulate the learning as solving a MMS problem.

item.title: WebCPM: Interactive Web Search for Chinese Long-form Question Answering
item.description: We recruit annotators to search for relevant information using our interface and then answer questions.

item.title: User-Controllable Latent Transformer for StyleGAN Image Layout Editing
item.description: In our framework, the user annotates a StyleGAN image with locations they want to move or not and specifies a movement direction by mouse dragging.

item.title: Decentralization and Acceleration Enables Large-Scale Bundle Adjustment
item.description: In this paper, we present a fully decentralized method that alleviates computation and communication bottlenecks to solve arbitrarily large bundle adjustment problems.

item.title: Seeing is Believing: Brain-Inspired Modular Training for Mechanistic Interpretability
item.description: We introduce Brain-Inspired Modular Training (BIMT), a method for making neural networks more modular and interpretable.

item.title: string2string: A Modern Python Library for String-to-String Algorithms
item.description: It includes traditional algorithmic solutions as well as recent advanced neural approaches to tackle various problems in string alignment, distance measurement, lexical and semantic search, and similarity analysis -- along with several helpful visualization tools and metrics to facilitate the interpretation and analysis of these methods.

item.title: HumanRF: High-Fidelity Neural Radiance Fields for Humans in Motion
item.description: To close the gap to production-level quality, we introduce HumanRF, a 4D dynamic neural scene representation that captures full-body appearance in motion from multi-view video input, and enables playback from novel, unseen viewpoints.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of LLMs in Practice: A Survey on ChatGPT and Beyond
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive and practical guide for practitioners and end-users working with Large Language Models (LLMs) in their downstream natural language processing (NLP) tasks.
